pr_title: Use cosmos changefeed for replication from azure to on prem dc

timeline.bodyText: Can remove "destination", possibly substitute "replication"
timeline.author: lightningrob

timeline.bodyText: Generic utility should be in utility class (if one doesn't exist already).
timeline.author: lightningrob

replies.bodyText: I'm pretty sure that Utils.readIntString already does the same thing as this method.

timeline.bodyText: Any reason this can't live in the azure subpackage?
timeline.author: lightningrob

replies.bodyText: Also, please document that it is based on Cosmos change feed.

timeline.bodyText: I find this class confusing, especially this getter method.  It definitely feels like a cache, so maybe the class name should say so.  (I saw you mentioned it in the javadoc.) I originally thought this class would be used to actually run the change feed queries as opposed to delegating that to the data accessor and holding the results.
timeline.author: lightningrob

replies.bodyText:
I have renamed this to CosmosChangeFeedCache.
The reason I have delegated query to CosmosDataAccessor is that I want to keep all the calls to cosmos apis at one place.

timeline.bodyText: The last 3-4 lines have a lot of duplicate code, please simplify it.

timeline.bodyText: Don't you have an equals method that does the same check?

replies.bodyText: this is not exactly same as equals, as it can have a different index. Semantically this is a different test than equals. It tests that the cache is still valid for the change feed token in request.

timeline.bodyText: Use Utils.serializeString for all of the size prefixed string type things here. It handles edge cases around character encodings.

timeline.bodyText: Maybe implement the general Object.equals method? You just need to add null handling and type checking to this method.

+package com.github.ambry.cloud.azure;
+
+import com.github.ambry.cloud.CloudBlobMetadata;
+import com.github.ambry.replication.FindToken;
+import com.microsoft.azure.cosmosdb.DocumentClientException;

+
+/**
+ * The replication feed that provides next list of blobs to replicate from azure, and a bookmark in form of {@link FindToken}.
+ */
+public interface AzureReplicationFeed {
+
+  /**
+   * Populate the next set of {@link CloudBlobMetadata} objects in {@code nextEntries} of specified partition {@code partitionPath}
+   * from the specified {@link FindToken} such that total size of all blobs in the entries are less or equal to {@code maxTotalSizeOfEntries}.
+   * This method should return at least one blob, if exists, after {@code curfindToken}, irrespective of {@code maxTotalSizeOfEntries} requirement.
+   * @param curfindToken current {@link FindToken} object that acts as a bookmark to return blobs after.
+   * @param nextEntries {@link List} to populate next {@link CloudBlobMetadata} objects in.
+   * @param maxTotalSizeOfEntries max total size of all the {@link CloudBlobMetadata} objects returned.
+   * @param partitionPath partition of the blobs.
+   * @return Updated {@link FindToken} object which can act as a bookmark for subsequent requests.
+   */
+  FindToken getNextEntriesAndUpdatedToken(FindToken curfindToken, List<CloudBlobMetadata> nextEntries,

replies.bodyText: If you are handling the case where partition assignment "bounces back" to a VCR node, then mention that in a comment.  But I would prefer to remove the cache entry when a partition is unassigned (if that is feasible).
replies.author: lightningrob

replies.bodyText: Partition being unassigned notification comes from helix. Propagating that notification all the way to this cache seems like an overkill to me. For now since we do not have a need to propagate that to azure destination classes, I want to avoid that and keep things simple.
replies.author: ankagrawal

timeline.bodyText: CACHE_VALID_DURATION_IN_MS seems to be a little better.
timeline.author: jsjtzyy

timeline.bodyText: I wonder why we choose CACHE_INVALIDATION_DURATION_IN_MILLIS as initial delay. Can we use a random initial delay?
timeline.author: jsjtzyy

replies.bodyText: Because there is not point in using anything less than this period. If this thread gets scheduled before CACHE_INVALIDATION_DURATION_IN_MILLIS, there will be no items older than CACHE_INVALIDATION_DURATION_IN_MILLIS in the cache, and hence there will be nothing to invalidate. Only after CACHE_INVALIDATION_DURATION_IN_MILLIS there can be anything old enough to return  entry.getValue().isExpired() as true, to potentially become a candidate for invalidation.
replies.author: ankagrawal

3 integers are needed to store length of startContinuationToken, endContinuationToken and cacheSessionId.
2 integers are need for index and totalItems fields.

+package com.github.ambry.cloud.azure;
+
+import com.github.ambry.cloud.CloudBlobMetadata;
+import com.github.ambry.cloud.FindResult;
+import com.github.ambry.replication.FindToken;
+import com.microsoft.azure.cosmosdb.DocumentClientException;
+import java.util.List;
+
+
+/**
+ * The replication feed that provides next list of blobs to replicate from Azure, and a bookmark in form of {@link FindToken}.
+ */
+public interface AzureReplicationFeed {
+
+  enum FeedType {
+    /** Replication feed is obtained from cosmos change feed api */
+    COSMOS_CHANGE_FEED,
+
+    /** Replication feed is obtained from cosmos queries ordered by update time */
+    COSMOS_UPDATE_TIME
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Populate the next set of {@link CloudBlobMetadata} objects in {@code nextEntries} of specified partition {@code partitionPath}
+   * from the specified {@link FindToken} such that total size of all blobs in the entries are less or equal to {@code maxTotalSizeOfEntries}.
+   * This method should return at least one blob, if exists, after {@code curfindToken}, irrespective of {@code maxTotalSizeOfEntries} requirement.
+   * @param curfindToken current {@link FindToken} object that acts as a bookmark to return blobs after.
+   * @param maxTotalSizeOfEntries max total size of all the {@link CloudBlobMetadata} objects returned.
+   * @param partitionPath partition of the blobs.
+   * @return {@link FindResult} instance that contains updated {@link FindToken} object which can act as a bookmark for
+   * subsequent requests, and {@link List} of {@link CloudBlobMetadata} entries.
+   */
+  FindResult getNextEntriesAndUpdatedToken(FindToken curfindToken, long maxTotalSizeOfEntries, String partitionPath)
+      throws DocumentClientException;

timeline.author: cgtz

timeline.bodyText:
Since you are not using daemon threads and the executor is not shutdown, this may block the jvm process from ending in some cases.
The server/vcr does have a shared scheduler that could be passed into here, if its not too cumbersome to get it all the way here. Alternatively you could make ReplicationFeed closable and shutdown the ExecutorService yourself.
timeline.author: cgtz

timeline.bodyText: if the populateChangeFeedCache methods returned the CacheEntry objects they added, you could get rid of a lot of the duplicate get calls to the cache in getNextEntriesAndUpdatedToken. It also may help to avoid some edge cases where the background cache eviction thread could remove items from the cache while the getNextEntriesAndUpdatedToken is executing (causing NPEs).
timeline.author: cgtz
cgtz

feedResponse.getResults().stream().map(doc -> createMetadataFromDocument(doc)).forEach(changeFeed::add)

timeline.message: Add clouddestinationtoken

Remove factory for cloud destination tokens.
Add Change feed cache.
Rename AzureCloudDestinationToken to AzureFindToken. Move AzureFindToken to cloud module.
End to end production code.
start test code and bug fix in prod code.

Tests for change feed implementation.
All tests passing.

Change defaults in azure find token to empty string.
All tests passing.

Add support for multiple azure replication feed types.
Make azure find token type configurable
Address review comments
rebase and rebase fixes
Add back update time based token and its tests.
Run azure cloud destination test with both change feed and update time tokens
cleanup
Add missing javadocs
Make latch based cloud destination support both replication feeds
Add parameterized tests for all findEntriesSince tests

Fix a bug in serialization of CloudBlobMetadata
Add token type based parameterized test to AzureIntegrationTest
Use correct Utils apis
Remove cosmoschangefeedcache class and merge it into cosmoschangedfeedbasedreplicationfeed
Add review comments
Use FindResult instead of passing around lists
Rename azureRequestId to cacheSessionId. Make changefeed cache keyed by session id so that multiple replicas of the same partition pulling from same vcr can be handled.
Fix unit test
Make CosmosChangeFeedBasedReplicationFeed class final as we are creating a thread in its constructor
Address review comments
Fix annotations
Add metrics for changefeedquery. Remove Parameterized tests. Add tests for queryChangeFeed.
Make CosmosChangeFeedFindTokenFactory as default for replication from cloud.
Address Casey's review comments
Minimize cache operations in cosmos change feed cache to reason about concurrency issues in a better way.
Make CloudDestination and AzureReplicationFeed extend closeable interface for cleanup.
Make CloudDestination and AzureReplicationFeed extend closeable interface for cleanup.
